intro: Commiphora dancaliensis, commonly known as the Socotra cinnamomum, is a flowering plant native to the Socotra archipelago. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its unique, aromatic leaves and small yellowish flowers. The plant produces a resinous sap that has been historically used for medicinal and aromatic purposes. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its restricted distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
